intro: Uapaca casteelsii, commonly known as the African velvetbean, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers followed by dark blue to black berries. Its fruit is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor, making it valuable in local cuisines. Uapaca casteelsii is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
